alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Hart (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 4:56PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Franklin, northern Hart and south central Oconee Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 456 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles east of Carnesville, or near Canon, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hartwell, Carnesville, Royston, Lavonia, Gumlog, Canon, Franklin Springs, Bowersville, Tugaloo State Park and Victoria Bryant State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
